**The Supreme Most Mysterious Jade Maiden of the Three Primordials’ Precepts for Removing Transgressions: Wondrous Scripture**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Most Mysterious Jade Maiden of the Three Primordials’ Precepts for Removing Transgressions: Wondrous Scripture*. Author unknown, likely composed during the Northern and Southern Dynasties or the Sui-Tang period. Adapted and expanded from *The Scripture on the Merits and Gravity of the Three Primordials’ Precepts*. Three scrolls. Base text from *The Orthodox Daoist Canon*, *Dongzhen* Section, *Benwen* Category.

---

**Scroll One**

The Most Mysterious Jade Maiden spoke: In the primordial Dragon Han kalpa, the Jade Emperor of the Supreme Dao, upon the Three Heavens, expounded the great *Three Caverns* Dharma—*The Wondrous Scripture of the Three Primordials’ Precepts*—to the assembled host of celestial sages, perfected immortals of the ten directions, and boundless assemblies of great saints. At that time, the officials of the Three Realms and the divine immortals of the myriad heavens, numbering in the hundreds of millions, all gathered in solemn attendance, reverently listening to the Dharma-sound.

Then, the Most High Lord of Primordial Beginning addressed the great assembly, saying: "I now broadly proclaim the wondrous Dharma of the Three Vehicles and the precious scriptures of the Three Caverns to all beings within and beyond the Three Realms. I open the path for humans and devas, descending in accord with conditions to receive the beings of the Lower Realm. In the latter age, men and women who do not hear the Dao and its teachings are wrongfully slain in great numbers, failing to complete their allotted years. This arises from the heavy karmic burdens and deep transgressions of humankind, who do not return to the true transformation, turning their backs on reality to follow falsehood, employing only perverse conduct. After death, their souls have no refuge, bound and lodged within the Fengdu Hell. When kalpas end and mountains crumble, they have no means of liberation.

You, all beings, shall throughout the great chiliocosm and the lands of the ten directions, teach all faithful men and women that from this day forward, they must recite *The Precious Scripture of the Three Primordials* and *The Wondrous Canon of the Jade Maiden*. The merit of this scripture ascends to deliver the heavenly beings and descends to succor those in the long night; its blessings are boundless, its grace sustaining the myriad existences. It spares one from the moment of life’s end, preventing the soul from entering Fengdu to suffer karmic retribution."

At that time, the Purple Tenuity Emperor Lord of the First Primordial’s Ninefold *Qi* Celestial Office, the talisman of extended life formed from the *qi* of the Beginning Yang, dwelt in the Palace of Seven Treasures of Primordial Yang within the Mysterious Capital, seated upon the Terrace of Azure Radiance in the Hall of Purple Mist, upon a throne of fivefold clouds and a couch of purple gold, leaning upon a table of azure jade, holding a scepter of green jasper. Divine immortals stood in ranks to his left and right, attending as guards.

The Palace of the Upper Primordial extended five thousand myriad *li* in length and breadth, entirely formed from the *qi* of the Mysterious Azure. It presides over the Supreme Lord of the Jade Void, the High Emperor of the Celestial Worthy of Spontaneous Perfection, the lords of the myriad heavens, the perfected immortals, as well as the rulers of nations, great ministers, empresses, imperial consorts, princes, crown princes, all officials and their families, and the people of the world—every distinction of nobility and baseness, transgression and blessing. The divine officials and bureaucrats therein are all constituted of spontaneous *qi*; unless one is a person of the Golden Portal whose name is recorded on the Jade Tablets of the attained Dao, none may behold it.

Within the Purple Tenuity Palace are the Three Bureaus of Left, Right, and Center. The Left Bureau governs the Office of Life, examined by the Fire Official of the Great Yang. The Right Bureau governs the Office of Death, examined by the Water Official of the Great Yin. The Central Bureau governs the Office of Life, Death, Transgression, and Blessing, examined by the Wind Blade. The Three Bureaus comprise thirty-six departments, each overseeing nine thousand myriad officials. On the evening of the Upper Primordial, they collectively examine the causes and karmic retributions of life, death, transgression, and blessing throughout the great chiliocosm and the lands of the ten directions. All beings should be reverent, each person respectful.

The thirty-six Celestial Officials of the departments above are governed by the Perfected Person of the Most Mysterious Jade Maiden, subordinate to the Purple Tenuity Palace.

Each department is staffed with one Examiner, one thousand two hundred Examining Clerks, twelve thousand Examining Soldiers, and one hundred twenty thousand Examining Scholars. Together, they oversee all beings in Heaven who have attained the Dao in past lives or have yet to attain it, those presently enjoying blessings, rulers and their ministers, celestial princes, empresses and imperial consorts, all officials and chief ministers, as well as devout men and women—recording their merits, transgressions, sins, and blessings, and assessing the karmic accounts and allotted lifespans.

On the fifteenth day of the first lunar month each year, the Celestial Official of the Upper Primordial, the Purple Tenuity Emperor Lord, reviews and evaluates the following across the great thousandfold world and the ten directions’ lands: from the celestial registers of gods and immortals’ ascents and descents, the astrological records of stellar influences over lands and their rise and fall; through the lifespans of rulers, worthy ministers, princes, and all beings; down to the transformations of fish, dragons, and all flying and crawling creatures—recording the years and months of their rebirths and demotions. Within the Three Paths and the Nine Departments, the names of those due for karmic retribution and the durations of their sentences are noted. Those deemed fit to be reborn as humans have their names erased from the registers of the Long Night’s Department and inscribed in the Left Palace. Those destined to become various kinds of demons, evil spirits, or ghosts have their sentences carved in the Right Palace, their names written in the Black Register, awaiting the fulfillment of their allotted time before being reborn in different forms, their rebirths varying according to the weight of their karma.

Among the sinful souls fated to become flying or crawling creatures, their forms are assigned based on the severity of their sins: some as jackals, wolves, tigers, or leopards; some as donkeys, horses, camels, or mules; some as oxen, sheep, geese, or ducks; some as chickens, dogs, turtledoves, or owls; some as river deer, muntjacs, foxes, or hares; some as sparrows, wagtails, flies, or insects; some as dung beetles, mantises, snakes, or rats; some as mole crickets, ants, mosquitoes, or horseflies; some as dust deer or qilin; some as soft-shelled turtles, alligators, tortoises, or giant turtles; some as flood dragons, mirages, cave-dwelling serpents, or water dragons; some as great whales or sea horses; some as conches, clams, insects, or fish; some as crows, pheasants, peacocks, or eagles; some as hawks, sparrowhawks, or flying leopards; some as toads, fleas, or lice; some as ants, centipedes, or millipedes; some as loaches, eels, or jellyfish; some as crabs, scorpions, or spiders; or as creatures of bizarre forms—birds, fish, flying beasts, or monstrous creatures. Such myriad beings may walk, fly, crawl, or sit; they may have many legs or none; they may be born from wombs or eggs; they may dwell in dry or wet places, in nests or burrows. With a hundred forms and a thousand transformations, their names cannot be fixed.

Some dwell in ancient trees or strange rocks; some inhabit deep pools, marshes, or springs; some cling to earthen hills or rocky cliffs; some lurk in wells, stoves, ditches, or canals; some manifest as demons or monsters among humans. All these myriad creatures, burdened with karmic lives, await the fulfillment of their allotted time. On the night when the Celestial Officials review the registers, they are reborn according to their karma, rewarded according to their blessings, cycled through kalpas, and reborn or die according to their deeds. Good and evil follow conditions without distinction.

If devout men or women resolve to copy this scripture, distribute and recite it, offer incense, flowers, precious canopies, and make offerings to the Celestial Worthies, all their sins will be eradicated. Or, on the evenings of the Three Primordials, they may perform rites to thank the Celestial Worthies; or on the ten auspicious days, recite this scripture to gain immeasurable blessings.

The Jade Maiden of the Great Mystery states: The merits of this scripture can resolve karmic grievances from a hundred lifetimes, erase sins from ten thousand kalpas, eliminate the transgressions of embodied existence, dispel unforeseen disasters, free one from the suffering of death and rebirth, and dissolve the hearts of all evils.

All beings from this day forward, if afflicted by official misfortune, illness, curses, or vengeful foes, should recite this scripture. If stricken by epidemics, pestilence, or possessed by ghosts and demons, they should hold and recite this scripture. If seeking to prosper in livelihood, venture into the sea for wealth, undertake construction, establish a home, or bury the dead, they should recite this scripture. If facing setbacks in career or demotion in office, or if traveling by boat and fearing waves, they should recite this scripture. To deliver the long-night-bound souls, rescue the suffering in darkness, resolve ancient calamities, and save those in hidden torment, they need only recite this scripture to gain immeasurable blessings.

If locusts, floods, wars, or rebellions arise, causing rulers distress and people to perish, one should establish a ritual arena in a pure place or an ancient altar within a sacred temple, hang banners and canopies, recite this scripture, light lamps, perform the Daoist walk, and hold a grand offering to the Five Stars and all celestial bodies. Then the land will be at peace, the times harmonious, the people prosperous; locusts and wars will naturally dissipate, and disasters of flood, drought, and wind will be averted.

If devout men or women suffer lifelong misfortune, weak fate, chronic illness, or incurable afflictions; if they repeatedly violate the law, endure years in shackles; if they are afflicted by madness or possessed by evil spirits—they should copy this scripture, distribute it among beings, and recite it together. For those who do so, all disasters will dissolve, all evils will vanish, their lifespans will be prolonged, and they will gain immeasurable blessings.

The Jade Maiden of the Great Mystery states: All beings cycle through birth and death, their karmic retributions and blessings manifesting without the slightest error. All await the days of the Three Primordials and the nights when the Three Officials review the registers, determining their rebirths, wealth or poverty, paths as humans or ghosts, or forms as birds or beasts. Those destined for blessings have their names inscribed in the Left Palace and carved in the Left Department. Those fated to become ghosts or beasts have their names written in the Right Department and carved in the Right Palace, each awaiting the fulfillment of their allotted time.

The Jade Maiden of the Great Mystery states: All devout men and women who attain immortal names have their merits and transgressions recorded on jade tablets. Those who have fallen from ranks or await karmic retribution for sins and blessings are likewise recorded in the lifespan registers of the Purple Tenuity Palace. All are sealed in the Jade Cabinet of the Luminous Perfected of the Mysterious Capital, the White Department of the Upper Primordial Celestial Official. They await the days when the Three Officials gather the sages to determine the registers of gods and immortals’ ascents and descents, the depths of karmic conditions for good and evil men and women, the lengths of their lifespans, and the durations of their allotted times. Even the release of those in the Nine Dark Realms from the limits of life, death, sin, and blessing, and the cycles of birth, transformation, decline, and prosperity for all creatures, are recorded and presented to the Supreme Void Emperor Lord of the Dao on the day of the Upper Primordial.

Lady Qing said: Within the great thousandfold world and the lands of the ten directions, all good and evil men and women—whether in matters of life, death, sin, or blessing, the weight of their deeds, the span of their lifetimes, or the reckoning of their years, months, and days—are each distinguished in the green and black registers and presented to the Upper Palace. If their virtuous deeds are complete and they are due to become immortals, their names are recorded in the Purple Tenuity Palace. If they have revered the Supreme Dao of the Primordial Mysterious Origin, their names are inscribed in the Left Palace of the Great Ultimate, written in the Golden Register, and engraved in the Immortal Bureau. The Earth Official is then commanded to dispatch attendants to record their names in the Upper Palace, where the Three Realms provide protection. All external demons will no longer disturb them, in accordance with the statutes of Lady Qing. Their names shall be inscribed on the green and black tablets of the Azure Mystery.

Now, the comprehensive registers of life and death overseen by the Supreme Perfected are recorded as follows. All you sentient beings must reverently uphold them:

The protocols for the merits and transgressions of the Great Sages in their rotating banquets and imperial escorts.

The protocols for the merits and transgressions in the weighing of the lightness and heaviness of karmic virtue in life and death.
The protocols for the merits and transgressions in the service and retribution of ghosts and spirits through the turning of the Wheel.
The protocols for the merits and transgressions in the terms of confinement and deliverance of ghosts and spirits in the dark realms.
The protocols for the merits and transgressions in the ascension of ghosts and spirits and the rebirth of the dead.
The protocols for the merits and transgressions in the registers of the dead undergoing refinement and rebirth.
The protocols for the merits and transgressions in the ranks and purity of immortals who attain the Dao.
The protocols for the merits and transgressions in the sounds of the myriad demons’ chants and songs.

The aforementioned are the names of all merits and transgressions overseen by the Supreme Perfected within the Three Realms and the lands of the ten directions. On each of the Three Primordial evenings, the green and black registers are inscribed and presented to the Upper Palace. All are delivered according to the depth of their sins or blessings, and retribution is meted out in accordance with the weight of their karma, without distinction between humans and celestials.

All you sentient beings must recite this scripture, maintain reverent offerings of incense and flowers, and make various devotions. Then shall your calamities be forever dispelled, your blessings swell like the vast sea, your grievances and disputes cease to assail you, and both the living and the dead attain peace.

I shall now, for all good and faithful men and women within the great thousandfold world and the lands of the ten directions, repent all sins and cause them to be wholly eradicated, so that no evil retribution remains.

Repent the sin of good men and women who do not believe in the sacred Dao and scriptures, harboring doubts and divided hearts.
Repent the sin of disciples who slight the sacred Dao and sacred texts, criticizing and debating the scriptures.
Repent the sin of disciples who steal, deface, or disrespectfully handle images of the Dao and scriptures, or who receive and uphold them without reverence for their masters and lineages.
Repent the sin of disciples who, without a master, self-transmit the Three Caverns’ scriptures and methods and teach them to disciples.
Repent the sin of disciples who slight their masters, violating their vows and pledges.
Repent the sin of disciples who slander their masters, failing to honor the celestial principles.
Repent the sin of disciples who conceal and obstruct the scriptures and methods of the Three Caverns, preventing their circulation.
Repent the sin of disciples who, having obtained immortal scriptures and wondrous methods, recklessly transmit them to unworthy recipients.
Repent the sin of disciples who, upon receiving scriptures and methods, do not adhere to the precepts, carelessly divulging sacred texts.
Repent the sin of disciples who, after transmitting scriptures, do not honor their masters’ agreements.
Repent the sin of disciples who, after receiving scriptures, fail to deliver all sentient beings.
Repent the sin of disciples who, without cause, destroy or deface images, scriptures, or ritual objects of the Primordial Mysterious Dao.
Repent the sin of disciples who, in transmitting scriptures and methods, do not first memorialize the heavens, swear oaths to the Five Emperors and Three Officials, or follow proper protocols.
Repent the sin of disciples who, after receiving scriptures, lack faith and reverence, belittling the Dao and slighting their masters.
Repent the sin of disciples who obstruct the paths of the sacred Dao, preventing its universal spread, seeking personal fame.
Repent the sin of disciples who, on the days of the new moon, full moon, and eight festivals, do not pay respects to their masters and teachers, acting with arrogance.
Repent the sin of disciples who, on days of fasting and vigil, do not maintain pure incense and offerings, failing to act for the sake of all beings.
Repent the sin of disciples who, in reciting scriptures, skip passages, lack compassion for beings, and boast of their own cleverness.
Repent the sin of those who study the supreme Dao but act out of order, competing for merit and fame.
Repent the sin of disciples who, after receiving the Dao, encounter misfortune in their families but do not reflect on their own faults, instead blaming the Dao and resenting their masters.
Repent the sin of disciples who slander good people, falsely accuse the sun and moon, belittle the sacred Dao, and honor heterodox teachings.
Repent the sin of disciples who engage in double-tongued slander, drunken raving, and criticize the four assemblies.
Repent the sin of disciples who indulge in greed, lust, and arrogance, defiling the true vehicle.
Repent the sin of disciples who have cursed spirits, uttered frivolous words, or killed living beings.
Repent the sin of disciples who engage in licentious and impure acts, envy the worthy, resent the good, or steal others’ property.
Repent the sin of disciples who deceive their masters, slight the Dao, or reveal immortal secrets.
Repent the sin of disciples who slander scriptures, oppress beings, and do not follow the true Dao.
Repent the sin of disciples who speak of others’ faults, seek personal fame, practice duplicity, conceal malice, slight immortals and sages, or boast of their own merit.
Repent the sin of disciples who bully their fellow students, neglect beings, and cause them distress.
Repent the sin of disciples who defile the Three Treasures, alter sacred instruments, measure sacred texts, call truth falsehood, honor heterodox teachings, slander the Great Vehicle, or cause the pure to act wickedly.
Repent the sin of disciples who rely on wealth and power to damage sacred texts, deceive beings into suffering hardship, or envy and harm the worthy, preventing their safety.
Repent the sin of disciples who destroy immortal abodes, call reality illusion, encroach on sacred lands, ally with evil, protect the strong, or damage altars and harm sacred precincts.

Such sins, upon hearing or reciting this sutra, shall all be extinguished.

Furthermore, repent the sins of disciples from beginningless time until this day—those who have harmed the good and aided the wicked, benefited themselves at others’ expense, or restrained and struck beings, cutting off their grain and water. Repent the sins of those who, through public law, have deeply entangled themselves in criminal charges; who have set fires to mountains, harming all sentient beings; who have dried up streams and brooks, slaughtering insects and fish; who have severed springs, preventing their flow and moisture; who have severed others’ bonds of affection, causing them to be scorned, their kin torn apart; who have sought profit and fame at the expense of the good and kind; who have spread poison to kill sentient beings; who have exploited beings to enrich themselves; who have falsely interpreted scriptural meanings, failing to align with the sagely intent; who have slandered sacred texts, dismissing them as false; or who, failing to study the origins of the Three Caverns, have defiled the scriptures and images of the Three Clarities.

Such sins as these are boundless, as countless as the grains of dust, impossible to exhaust. They fall under the jurisdiction of the Heavenly Officials’ Thirty-Six Bureaus, subject to the trials of the Wind and Blade.

If, within the ten directions’ worlds of fine dust and the great-thousand lands, all faithful men and women—from beginningless time until this day—along with their parents, siblings, and six kinds of kin, have committed such sins, let them but recite, transcribe, and distribute this sutra. The merit gained shall be immeasurable, their lifespan extended without end. All such sins, past and present, shall be extinguished, and all calamities and misfortunes shall be lifted.

At that time, the assembly of heavenly beings bowed their heads in reverence and practiced accordingly, intoning this verse:

The Primordial Celestial Origin,
The Supreme Dharma King,
Bestows grace upon the Three Realms,
Blessings upon the Ten Directions.
All beings rely upon it,
All creatures find peace.
The Dharma’s sound flows and transforms,
Delivering the living and the dead.
The Nine Dark Realms are liberated,
The Five Sufferings spared from woe.
Frozen pools thaw,
Darkness radiates light.
Recite, uphold, and make offerings—
Boundless fortune and blessings arise.

The Lady of the Supreme Mystery, the Azure Maiden, declares: The Middle Primordial Second-Rank Earth Official, the Pure Void Perfected Lord, oversees the left, right, and central Three Bureaus, comprising forty-two departments in total. The immortal officials of the Three Bureaus are all permeated with the primordial qi of cavernous emptiness, purity, and void; their palaces each span fifty million miles. Together, they govern the myriad deities and immortals of the Five Thearchs and Five Marchmounts. Among them, the immortal officials number ninety million in total.

They preside over the records of life and death for all good and evil men and women within the great thousandfold world and the lands of the ten directions. Karmic retribution, fortune and misfortune, the length of lifespan, wealth and poverty, nobility and lowliness—all are determined by the allotted span of years and months. Even the flying birds and running beasts of the world, all creatures that creep and swim, and every kind of living being—each has its time of transformation, following its destined limit. These matters are reported to the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace and await the celestial officials’ review of the registers.

Some may undergo transformation, their forms altered according to their blessings, their retribution received in accord with their karma, each with its own span of years and months. If there are beings burdened by many karmic obstacles, whose actions bring no benefit, they should, with rare flowers, precious fruits, pure water, and fragrant incense, diligently and reverently beseech their master day and night, recite this scripture, perform rites for the Three Primordials, and report their merits on the eight seasonal nodes. Thus, their misfortunes shall be forever dispelled, and their names inscribed on golden tablets.

The merit of this scripture can cure all illnesses, dispel all sufferings, resolve calamities, eliminate all evils, gather a thousand blessings, bring a hundred fortunes, extend lifespan, and deliver those sunk in darkness. You, all beings, need only receive and uphold it to gain boundless blessings.

Now, the positions of the immortal officials of the left, right, and central Three Bureaus and the forty-two departments are revealed. You, all beings, need only make offerings to them, and their merit in aiding the imprisoned spirits shall be inexhaustible. All should revere them with utmost sincerity.

The forty-two departments of the right palace, established by the Lady of the Supreme Mystery, the Azure Maiden, belong to the Palace of Cavernous Emptiness and Purity. Each has its left, right, and central Three Bureaus. Each bureau has one examining official, one hundred twenty examining clerks, one thousand two hundred examining scholars, and twelve thousand examining soldiers. Together, they govern the divine persons of the Five Marchmounts, the earth sovereigns of the nine lands, the deities of the four quarters and eight directions, all immortal officials, and those who have attained the Dao among the learned adepts.

They also record the merits, transgressions, sins, and blessings of all faithful men and women. Those of great fortune are reviewed every three years; those of middling fortune, every nine years; and those of lesser fortune, every twenty-four years. Sins and blessings are both enacted, merits and transgressions equally recompensed. Their registers are sealed in the cavernous palaces of the Five Marchmounts and await the evenings of the Three Primordials, the days when the Three Officials gather in sacred assembly, and the nights of review. The upper review examines the limits of transformation for divine persons; the middle review examines the records of success and failure, advancement and retreat for all those cultivating the Dao within the great thousandfold world; the lower review examines the transformations and service limits of all ghosts and spirits within the Three Realms.

Moreover, within the lands of the ten directions, in all mountains, rivers, cavernous grottoes, seas, earth, and stones, in all ancient trees and springs, whether dragons, unicorns, lions, peacocks, phoenixes, soft-shelled turtles, tortoises, fish, tigers, leopards, monkeys, apes, river deer, muntjacs, flood dragons, pythons, crows, pheasants, raccoon dogs, wolves, dogs, pigs, turtledoves, sparrows, rats, or any creatures that fly or walk, with scales or shells, camels, mules, elephants, horses, oxen, sheep, and the like—whether with four feet, two feet, many feet, or no feet, born from the womb or from eggs, dwelling in nests or earthen burrows, in deep waters or mud, leaning on ancient trees or springs, beside sacred altars, wells, or hearths, in hills or ancient tombs, or within old vessels and sacred altars—all these beings of various forms and appearances, the spirits of all manner of creatures, along with all demonic and spectral beings, may bring fortune among humans or disaster upon the world.

At the appointed time of destiny’s reckoning, all shall be examined and judged. Though these manifold kinds dwell in the world, their state is never fixed. Those who bring no harm to humans—when the time of scrutiny arrives—shall be transformed into human form. The span of their wealth or poverty, nobility or lowliness, shall be determined by the measure of their karmic deeds. But if any of these myriad kinds, while dwelling among humans, inflict harm and torment upon all beings, then at the hour of judgment they shall be made to change their forms and endure renewed suffering: cast as lowly beasts, or as base spirits, dying to traverse the Nine Dark Realms, with no hope of deliverance.

Should any being exhort and guide their kin to transcribe this sutra, bestow it upon the people, and together recite it, their merit shall be boundless. In every life, they shall be comely in form, long in years, and their blessings shall extend to their descendants.

The Celestial Maiden Qing declares: Such immortal officials oversee the Three Realms and Nine Lands, the Five Peaks and Four Quarters, all beings—men and women alike—recording their good and evil deeds in the Azure and Black Registers. They note the karmic retribution of those due for salvation, the dates of their judgment, and the names of those yet unenlightened who bear the weight of their sins. All is recorded in accordance with the statutes of the Pure Void and submitted to the Upper Palace.

Then, the Most High Lord of the Primordial Beginning addressed the celestial hosts, the perfected immortals of the ten directions, the sublime adepts, and the deities of the sun, moon, and stars: “From this day forth, on the Three Primordial Days, you shall descend to the Palace of Pure Void and Luminous Yang in the Northern Capital. There, you shall assemble to review the registers of all beings in the Nine Lands of the earth—recording their lives, deaths, merits, transgressions, and sins. Their fortunes and misfortunes shall be inscribed upon the Azure and Black Tablets of life and death. Every transformation of humans and spirits, every change of form among birds and fish, must be duly recorded and submitted to the Upper Palace.”

Then, the celestial immortals, the stellar deities, the true spirits of the Five Peaks, Four Controllers, Five Emperors, and Eight Poles, the officials of the Three Realms, and all divine beings received their commands and pledged to obey.

The celestial hosts then addressed the Most High Lord: “When the Three Officials conduct their review of the registers, throughout the great thousand worlds and the lands of the ten directions, all beings—men and women, good and evil—shall have their lives, deaths, sins, and merits recorded in the Azure and Black Registers. Their deeds shall be weighed by the gravity of their offenses, and their fates determined accordingly. Those destined for rebirth shall be named in the Left Palace; those bound for immortality, in the Central Palace; and those doomed to die, in the Right Palace. The days and months of their merits, transgressions, lives, and deaths shall be recorded with utmost precision, leaving no room for error.

If any faithful man or woman, burdened by heavy karmic obstacles and beset by misfortune, should transcribe this sutra, bestow it upon others, and recite it together—or if they uphold it with devotion, offering incense, flowers, and various reverent offerings—their merit shall be boundless. All disasters shall be healed, karmic obstacles dissolved, and their lives prolonged. Blessings shall extend to both the living and the dead, and even the dragon spirits shall bear this grace. You, all beings, must heed my words: practice goodness and repent your transgressions.

Throughout the ten directions, in the dust-mote worlds and the great thousand lands, all faithful men and women—from time immemorial to this very day—may have committed the following sins:

Using unworthy men for unjust purposes, or the sin of vain and deceitful speech.
Greedily amassing wealth for oneself, insatiable and unfulfilled.
Hoarding treasures and still coveting more.
Luring the virtuous into evil deeds.
Wishing harm upon the kind and causing their ruin or dispersal.
Destroying or defacing the sacred scriptures of the Great Cavern and holy images.
Slaughtering beings for one’s own pleasure.
Shooting or hunting wild beasts, birds, and creatures.
Burning mountains to capture prey, killing all living things.
Using gold, silver, or rare treasures for dining vessels without shame.
Succumbing to desire and wantonly taking lives.
Burning or destroying sacred altars, immortal abodes, revered images, and scriptures.
Discarding food into filth.
Indulging in rich, impure flavors, gluttonous and insatiable.
Consuming the Five Pungent Herbs, defiling the Dao and the immortals.
Willfully distorting scriptures, disregarding sacred texts.
Gathering crowds to kill living beings.
Plotting against the kind, scheming against their kin, spouses, or children.
Betraying one’s lord and scheming against the land.
Slandering the true scriptures and sacred texts of the Great Dao.
Exchanging coarse goods for fine ones.
Defacing the images of the Most High Lord, true immortals, or jade maidens.
Pointing at stars and recklessly predicting fortune or misfortune.
Burning the storehouses, homes, and dwellings of beings.
Felling trees, flowers, or fruits in sacred groves or immortal abodes.
Consorting with evil men and slandering the virtuous.
Slandering the sacred Dao and its scriptures, falsely distinguishing their weight.
Misinterpreting profound mysteries, distorting scriptural meaning, and misrepresenting the sacred will.
Clinging to barbarian sorcery and slandering the Great Vehicle of the sacred Dao.
Recklessly wandering the world, mocking the Three Treasures.
Praising others to their faces while harboring deceit in their hearts.
Falsely speaking ill of superiors, lacking filial piety.
Revealing the secret arts of immortals or sacred texts.
Attacking the virtuous without cause."

Or relying on power and influence to deceive and cheat the common people—such is the sin.

Or allying with wicked factions to undermine the virtuous—such is the sin.
Or envying and harming those superior to oneself, seeking to ruin the wise and virtuous—such is the sin.

Now, for all you beings, I have expounded these sins as above. All such transgressions fall under the scrutiny of the Three Primordials’ divine clerks and immortal officials. Throughout the great thousandfold world, within the lands of the ten directions, all learned and virtuous men and women of faith—from beginningless time until this very day—who have violated the aforementioned sins: now, within this ritual arena, recite this scripture, repent fully, and beseech the complete eradication of all offenses.

Or on the fast days of the myriad heavens, failing to turn the mind toward goodness. Or having raged against and slandered masters and teachers, engaging in unjust debates. In the boundless worlds of all heavens, all sentient beings, you Daoist followers, should copy this scripture, distribute it, and recite it in turn. The merit of this scripture is inconceivable. All good men and women—wherever this scripture is reverently recited, wherever the mysterious images are enshrined—no disaster will remain unresolved, no misfortune will fail to be averted. **The Supreme Most Mysterious Jade Maiden of the Three Primordials’ Precepts for Removing Transgressions: Wondrous Scripture**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Most Mysterious Jade Maiden of the Three Primordials’ Precepts for Removing Transgressions: Wondrous Scripture*. Author unknown, likely composed during the Northern and Southern Dynasties or the Sui-Tang period. Adapted and expanded from *The Scripture on the Merits and Gravity of the Three Primordials’ Precepts*. Three scrolls. Base text from *The Orthodox Daoist Canon*, *Dongzhen* Section, *Benwen* Category.

---

**Scroll One**

The Most Mysterious Jade Maiden spoke: In the primordial Dragon Han kalpa, the Jade Emperor of the Supreme Dao, upon the Three Heavens, expounded the great *Three Caverns* Dharma—*The Wondrous Scripture of the Three Primordials’ Precepts*—to the assembled host of celestial sages, perfected immortals of the ten directions, and boundless assemblies of great saints. At that time, the officials of the Three Realms and the divine immortals of the myriad heavens, numbering in the hundreds of millions, all gathered in solemn attendance, reverently listening to the Dharma-sound.

Then, the Most High Lord of Primordial Beginning addressed the great assembly, saying: "I now broadly proclaim the wondrous Dharma of the Three Vehicles and the precious scriptures of the Three Caverns to all beings within and beyond the Three Realms. I open the path for humans and devas, descending in accord with conditions to receive the beings of the Lower Realm. In the latter age, men and women who do not hear the Dao and its teachings are wrongfully slain in great numbers, failing to complete their allotted years. This arises from the heavy karmic burdens and deep transgressions of humankind, who do not return to the true transformation, turning their backs on reality to follow falsehood, employing only perverse conduct. After death, their souls have no refuge, bound and lodged within the Fengdu Hell. When kalpas end and mountains crumble, they have no means of liberation.

You, all beings, shall throughout the great chiliocosm and the lands of the ten directions, teach all faithful men and women that from this day forward, they must recite *The Precious Scripture of the Three Primordials* and *The Wondrous Canon of the Jade Maiden*. The merit of this scripture ascends to deliver the heavenly beings and descends to succor those in the long night; its blessings are boundless, its grace sustaining the myriad existences. It spares one from the moment of life’s end, preventing the soul from entering Fengdu to suffer karmic retribution."

At that time, the Purple Tenuity Emperor Lord of the First Primordial’s Ninefold *Qi* Celestial Office, the talisman of extended life formed from the *qi* of the Beginning Yang, dwelt in the Palace of Seven Treasures of Primordial Yang within the Mysterious Capital, seated upon the Terrace of Azure Radiance in the Hall of Purple Mist, upon a throne of fivefold clouds and a couch of purple gold, leaning upon a table of azure jade, holding a scepter of green jasper. Divine immortals stood in ranks to his left and right, attending as guards.

The Palace of the Upper Primordial extended five thousand myriad *li* in length and breadth, entirely formed from the *qi* of the Mysterious Azure. It presides over the Supreme Lord of the Jade Void, the High Emperor of the Celestial Worthy of Spontaneous Perfection, the lords of the myriad heavens, the perfected immortals, as well as the rulers of nations, great ministers, empresses, imperial consorts, princes, crown princes, all officials and their families, and the people of the world—every distinction of nobility and baseness, transgression and blessing. The divine officials and bureaucrats therein are all constituted of spontaneous *qi*; unless one is a person of the Golden Portal whose name is recorded on the Jade Tablets of the attained Dao, none may behold it.

Within the Purple Tenuity Palace are the Three Bureaus of Left, Right, and Center. The Left Bureau governs the Office of Life, examined by the Fire Official of the Great Yang. The Right Bureau governs the Office of Death, examined by the Water Official of the Great Yin. The Central Bureau governs the Office of Life, Death, Transgression, and Blessing, examined by the Wind Blade. The Three Bureaus comprise thirty-six departments, each overseeing nine thousand myriad officials. On the evening of the Upper Primordial, they collectively examine the causes and karmic retributions of life, death, transgression, and blessing throughout the great chiliocosm and the lands of the ten directions. All beings should be reverent, each person respectful.

chunks.original_text: 每府各一考官、一千二百考吏、一万二千考兵，一十二万考士。 总主人天已得道过去及未得道者，见在福中，国主大臣、诸天太子、皇后皇妃、百官宰辅，及善信男子、女人，功过罪福簿录，缘对考限之事。 至每年正月十五日，则上元天官紫微帝君，考较大千世界之内、十方国土之中，上至诸天神仙升降之籍、星宿临照国土分野兴亡之簿，中至国主贤臣、诸王太子、一切众生考限之期，下至鱼龙变化飞走万类，改易身形，升沈年月。 至於三涂之内，九府之中，罪对之名，年劫之限，其内合得生为人者，则当削名长夜之府，列字左宫之中。 其内合为诸色，邪魔鬼神之者，则当刻限右宫，书名黑簿，俟其数满，又复改形，随其业力高下不同，受报各异。 内有罪魂合为飞走万类，亦当随罪轻重，分配生方，或为豺狼虎豹，或为驴马驼骡，或为牛羊鹅鸭，或为鸡犬鸠鸱，或作獐麂狐兔，或为雀鸰蝇虫，或作踣蜣娘蛇鼠，或作蝼蚁蚊虻，或为尘鹿麒麟，或作鼋鼉龟鳌，或作蛟蜃岫蜓，或为长鲸海马，或为螺蚌虫鱼，或为乌雉孔雀，或为鹰鹞飞狸，或为虾蟆蚤虱，或为曲蚁蜈蚣，或为鳅鳣水母，或作竭蟹蜘蛛，或作异状，禽鱼飞狂异兽。 如是种种万类，或走或飞，或行或坐，或多足无足，或胎生卵生，或乾居湿居，或巢居穴居，百形千变，不可定名。 或依古树怪石，或处渊泽泉源，或据土山岩石，或处井灶沟渠，或於人间作诸妖怪。 如是种种万类，一切负命之身，各俟考限满日。 天官考籍之宵，又当随业改形，随福受报，随劫轮转，随业死生，善恶随缘，无复差别。 若有善信男子女人，发心书写此经，散施转读，香花宝盖，供养诸天，如是所作之罪，悉皆消灭。 或於三元之夕，醮谢诸天，或於十直之辰，持诵此经，得福无量。 女青曰：此经功德，能解百生怨对，能消万劫罪愆，能灭有身之过，能除无妄之灾，能脱死生之苦，能解众恶之心。 一切众生自今以去，若有官灾疾病，咒诅冤家，当诵此经。 若有瘟癀疾疫，或被鬼魅所侵，即当持诵此经。 若欲兴生觅利，入海求财，或修造动土，立宅安坟，即当持诵此经。 或有功名不利，官职微退，或船行往返，或忧波浪所惊，亦当持诵此经。 若欲开度长夜，济拔幽魂，解释夙殃，救诸幽苦，但当持诵此经，得福无量。 或有虫蝗水潦，兵革四兴，国主忧惶，人民伤死，当於清净之地，或古坛灵观之中，建立道场，悬诸幡盖，转诵此经，然灯行道，大醮五星及诸天宿曜，则得国土清宁，时和俗泰，蝗虫兵革当自化消，水旱风灾自然得度。 若有善信男子女人，生来多厄，运命衰微，或久病着状，不能医治，或多犯王法，枷锁连年，或染风狂，或被邪魔所执，即当抄写此经，散施众生，共相转读。 若有众生能如是者，诸灾自解，众恶自消，寿命长久，得福无量。 女青曰：一切众生展转轮殁，生死报对，祸福应现，毫末无差，并俟三元之日，三官考籍之宵，分配死生，定其贫富，人鬼二路，禽兽万端。 合受福者，则当列字左宫，刻名左府。 合为鬼为畜者，则当书名右府，刻字右宫。 各俟考限之期也。 女青曰：一切善信男子、女人，或得仙名，当以玉简功过，或有除落品格罪福报应，亦如紫微宫中限簿录籍，并封玄都明真玉匮上元天官洞白之府，并俟三官集圣之日，定诸神仙升降之籍，及诸善恶男女祸福缘对深浅之由，寿算考限长短之名，下至九幽之内除放生死罪福之限，蠢动生化衰盛之期，并於上元之日录奏太上虚皇道君。

Each department is staffed with one Examiner, one thousand two hundred Examining Clerks, twelve thousand Examining Soldiers, and one hundred twenty thousand Examining Scholars. Together, they oversee all beings in Heaven who have attained the Dao in past lives or have yet to attain it, those presently enjoying blessings, rulers and their ministers, celestial princes, empresses and imperial consorts, all officials and chief ministers, as well as devout men and women—recording their merits, transgressions, sins, and blessings, and assessing the karmic accounts and allotted lifespans.

On the fifteenth day of the first lunar month each year, the Celestial Official of the Upper Primordial, the Purple Tenuity Emperor Lord, reviews and evaluates the following across the great thousandfold world and the ten directions’ lands: from the celestial registers of gods and immortals’ ascents and descents, the astrological records of stellar influences over lands and their rise and fall; through the lifespans of rulers, worthy ministers, princes, and all beings; down to the transformations of fish, dragons, and all flying and crawling creatures—recording the years and months of their rebirths and demotions. Within the Three Paths and the Nine Departments, the names of those due for karmic retribution and the durations of their sentences are noted. Those deemed fit to be reborn as humans have their names erased from the registers of the Long Night’s Department and inscribed in the Left Palace. Those destined to become various kinds of demons, evil spirits, or ghosts have their sentences carved in the Right Palace, their names written in the Black Register, awaiting the fulfillment of their allotted time before being reborn in different forms, their rebirths varying according to the weight of their karma.

Among the sinful souls fated to become flying or crawling creatures, their forms are assigned based on the severity of their sins: some as jackals, wolves, tigers, or leopards; some as donkeys, horses, camels, or mules; some as oxen, sheep, geese, or ducks; some as chickens, dogs, turtledoves, or owls; some as river deer, muntjacs, foxes, or hares; some as sparrows, wagtails, flies, or insects; some as dung beetles, mantises, snakes, or rats; some as mole crickets, ants, mosquitoes, or horseflies; some as dust deer or qilin; some as soft-shelled turtles, alligators, tortoises, or giant turtles; some as flood dragons, mirages, cave-dwelling serpents, or water dragons; some as great whales or sea horses; some as conches, clams, insects, or fish; some as crows, pheasants, peacocks, or eagles; some as hawks, sparrowhawks, or flying leopards; some as toads, fleas, or lice; some as ants, centipedes, or millipedes; some as loaches, eels, or jellyfish; some as crabs, scorpions, or spiders; or as creatures of bizarre forms—birds, fish, flying beasts, or monstrous creatures. Such myriad beings may walk, fly, crawl, or sit; they may have many legs or none; they may be born from wombs or eggs; they may dwell in dry or wet places, in nests or burrows. With a hundred forms and a thousand transformations, their names cannot be fixed.

Some dwell in ancient trees or strange rocks; some inhabit deep pools, marshes, or springs; some cling to earthen hills or rocky cliffs; some lurk in wells, stoves, ditches, or canals; some manifest as demons or monsters among humans. All these myriad creatures, burdened with karmic lives, await the fulfillment of their allotted time. On the night when the Celestial Officials review the registers, they are reborn according to their karma, rewarded according to their blessings, cycled through kalpas, and reborn or die according to their deeds. Good and evil follow conditions without distinction.

If devout men or women resolve to copy this scripture, distribute and recite it, offer incense, flowers, precious canopies, and make offerings to the Celestial Worthies, all their sins will be eradicated. Or, on the evenings of the Three Primordials, they may perform rites to thank the Celestial Worthies; or on the ten auspicious days, recite this scripture to gain immeasurable blessings.

The Jade Maiden of the Great Mystery states: The merits of this scripture can resolve karmic grievances from a hundred lifetimes, erase sins from ten thousand kalpas, eliminate the transgressions of embodied existence, dispel unforeseen disasters, free one from the suffering of death and rebirth, and dissolve the hearts of all evils.

All beings from this day forward, if afflicted by official misfortune, illness, curses, or vengeful foes, should recite this scripture. If stricken by epidemics, pestilence, or possessed by ghosts and demons, they should hold and recite this scripture. If seeking to prosper in livelihood, venture into the sea for wealth, undertake construction, establish a home, or bury the dead, they should recite this scripture. If facing setbacks in career or demotion in office, or if traveling by boat and fearing waves, they should recite this scripture. To deliver the long-night-bound souls, rescue the suffering in darkness, resolve ancient calamities, and save those in hidden torment, they need only recite this scripture to gain immeasurable blessings.

If locusts, floods, wars, or rebellions arise, causing rulers distress and people to perish, one should establish a ritual arena in a pure place or an ancient altar within a sacred temple, hang banners and canopies, recite this scripture, light lamps, perform the Daoist walk, and hold a grand offering to the Five Stars and all celestial bodies. Then the land will be at peace, the times harmonious, the people prosperous; locusts and wars will naturally dissipate, and disasters of flood, drought, and wind will be averted.

If devout men or women suffer lifelong misfortune, weak fate, chronic illness, or incurable afflictions; if they repeatedly violate the law, endure years in shackles; if they are afflicted by madness or possessed by evil spirits—they should copy this scripture, distribute it among beings, and recite it together. For those who do so, all disasters will dissolve, all evils will vanish, their lifespans will be prolonged, and they will gain immeasurable blessings.

The Jade Maiden of the Great Mystery states: All beings cycle through birth and death, their karmic retributions and blessings manifesting without the slightest error. All await the days of the Three Primordials and the nights when the Three Officials review the registers, determining their rebirths, wealth or poverty, paths as humans or ghosts, or forms as birds or beasts. Those destined for blessings have their names inscribed in the Left Palace and carved in the Left Department. Those fated to become ghosts or beasts have their names written in the Right Department and carved in the Right Palace, each awaiting the fulfillment of their allotted time.

The Jade Maiden of the Great Mystery states: All devout men and women who attain immortal names have their merits and transgressions recorded on jade tablets. Those who have fallen from ranks or await karmic retribution for sins and blessings are likewise recorded in the lifespan registers of the Purple Tenuity Palace. All are sealed in the Jade Cabinet of the Luminous Perfected of the Mysterious Capital, the White Department of the Upper Primordial Celestial Official. They await the days when the Three Officials gather the sages to determine the registers of gods and immortals’ ascents and descents, the depths of karmic conditions for good and evil men and women, the lengths of their lifespans, and the durations of their allotted times. Even the release of those in the Nine Dark Realms from the limits of life, death, sin, and blessing, and the cycles of birth, transformation, decline, and prosperity for all creatures, are recorded and presented to the Supreme Void Emperor Lord of the Dao on the day of the Upper Primordial.

The Lady of the Supreme Mystery, the Azure Maiden, declares: The Middle Primordial Second-Rank Earth Official, the Pure Void Perfected Lord, oversees the left, right, and central Three Bureaus, comprising forty-two departments in total. The immortal officials of the Three Bureaus are all permeated with the primordial qi of cavernous emptiness, purity, and void; their palaces each span fifty million miles. Together, they govern the myriad deities and immortals of the Five Thearchs and Five Marchmounts. Among them, the immortal officials number ninety million in total.

These matters are reported to the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace and await the celestial officials’ review of the registers.

Some may undergo transformation, their forms altered according to their blessings, their retribution received in accord with their karma, each with its own span of years and months. At the appointed time of destiny’s reckoning, all shall be examined and judged. Though these manifold kinds dwell in the world, their state is never fixed. Those who bring no harm to humans—when the time of scrutiny arrives—shall be transformed into human form. The span of their wealth or poverty, nobility or lowliness, shall be determined by the measure of their karmic deeds. But if any of these myriad kinds, while dwelling among humans, inflict harm and torment upon all beings, then at the hour of judgment they shall be made to change their forms and endure renewed suffering: cast as lowly beasts, or as base spirits, dying to traverse the Nine Dark Realms, with no hope of deliverance.

Should any being exhort and guide their kin to transcribe this sutra, bestow it upon the people, and together recite it, their merit shall be boundless. In every life, they shall be comely in form, long in years, and their blessings shall extend to their descendants.

The Celestial Maiden Qing declares: Such immortal officials oversee the Three Realms and Nine Lands, the Five Peaks and Four Quarters, all beings—men and women alike—recording their good and evil deeds in the Azure and Black Registers. They note the karmic retribution of those due for salvation, the dates of their judgment, and the names of those yet unenlightened who bear the weight of their sins. All is recorded in accordance with the statutes of the Pure Void and submitted to the Upper Palace.

Then, the Most High Lord of the Primordial Beginning addressed the celestial hosts, the perfected immortals of the ten directions, the sublime adepts, and the deities of the sun, moon, and stars: “From this day forth, on the Three Primordial Days, you shall descend to the Palace of Pure Void and Luminous Yang in the Northern Capital. There, you shall assemble to review the registers of all beings in the Nine Lands of the earth—recording their lives, deaths, merits, transgressions, and sins. Their fortunes and misfortunes shall be inscribed upon the Azure and Black Tablets of life and death. Every transformation of humans and spirits, every change of form among birds and fish, must be duly recorded and submitted to the Upper Palace.”

Then, the celestial immortals, the stellar deities, the true spirits of the Five Peaks, Four Controllers, Five Emperors, and Eight Poles, the officials of the Three Realms, and all divine beings received their commands and pledged to obey.

The celestial hosts then addressed the Most High Lord: “When the Three Officials conduct their review of the registers, throughout the great thousand worlds and the lands of the ten directions, all beings—men and women, good and evil—shall have their lives, deaths, sins, and merits recorded in the Azure and Black Registers. Their deeds shall be weighed by the gravity of their offenses, and their fates determined accordingly. Those destined for rebirth shall be named in the Left Palace; those bound for immortality, in the Central Palace; and those doomed to die, in the Right Palace. The days and months of their merits, transgressions, lives, and deaths shall be recorded with utmost precision, leaving no room for error.

If any faithful man or woman, burdened by heavy karmic obstacles and beset by misfortune, should transcribe this sutra, bestow it upon others, and recite it together—or if they uphold it with devotion, offering incense, flowers, and various reverent offerings—their merit shall be boundless. All disasters shall be healed, karmic obstacles dissolved, and their lives prolonged. Blessings shall extend to both the living and the dead, and even the dragon spirits shall bear this grace. You, all beings, must heed my words: practice goodness and repent your transgressions.

Throughout the ten directions, in the dust-mote worlds and the great thousand lands, all faithful men and women—from time immemorial to this very day—may have committed the following sins:

Using unworthy men for unjust purposes, or the sin of vain and deceitful speech.
Greedily amassing wealth for oneself, insatiable and unfulfilled.
Hoarding treasures and still coveting more.
Luring the virtuous into evil deeds.
Wishing harm upon the kind and causing their ruin or dispersal.
Destroying or defacing the sacred scriptures of the Great Cavern and holy images.
Slaughtering beings for one’s own pleasure.
Shooting or hunting wild beasts, birds, and creatures.
Burning mountains to capture prey, killing all living things.
Using gold, silver, or rare treasures for dining vessels without shame.
Succumbing to desire and wantonly taking lives.
Burning or destroying sacred altars, immortal abodes, revered images, and scriptures.
Discarding food into filth.
Indulging in rich, impure flavors, gluttonous and insatiable.
Consuming the Five Pungent Herbs, defiling the Dao and the immortals.
Willfully distorting scriptures, disregarding sacred texts.
Gathering crowds to kill living beings.
Plotting against the kind, scheming against their kin, spouses, or children.
Betraying one’s lord and scheming against the land.
Slandering the true scriptures and sacred texts of the Great Dao.
Exchanging coarse goods for fine ones.
Defacing the images of the Most High Lord, true immortals, or jade maidens.
Pointing at stars and recklessly predicting fortune or misfortune.
Burning the storehouses, homes, and dwellings of beings.
Felling trees, flowers, or fruits in sacred groves or immortal abodes.
Consorting with evil men and slandering the virtuous.
Slandering the sacred Dao and its scriptures, falsely distinguishing their weight.
Misinterpreting profound mysteries, distorting scriptural meaning, and misrepresenting the sacred will.
Clinging to barbarian sorcery and slandering the Great Vehicle of the sacred Dao.
Recklessly wandering the world, mocking the Three Treasures.
Praising others to their faces while harboring deceit in their hearts.
Falsely speaking ill of superiors, lacking filial piety.
Revealing the secret arts of immortals or sacred texts.
Attacking the virtuous without cause."

The Three Grades of the Lower Primordial’s Water Officials are the qi of the Cavernous Primordial’s wind and marsh, the essence of the Vast Dawn. The Three Officials of the Lower Primordial are named: the Palace of the Cavernous Source of Yang Valley, the Palace of Azure Radiance, and the Palace of the Frigid Night. Their official retinue numbers ninety million in total.

Forms are not my possession, nor do names abide with me. That from which I am born arises from the void and spontaneity, coalescing qi to form this body. Thus, though I receive form, this form is not truly my form—it is but a temporary lodging, a manifest appearance. Therefore, those who attain the Dao are no longer bound to form.

All sentient beings suffer because they possess bodies. With a body come a hundred evils, and birth and death follow form. If one can align the mind with the true, the Dao will merge with it. When body and spirit are complete, one becomes a perfected person, returning to formlessness and accomplishing the Dao. No longer will there be suffering, nor death; the form will not perish to ashes, and the self will return to its origin.

All sentient beings—if their bodies commit a hundred evils, they must endure manifold sufferings and cannot yet return to life. These bodies of good and evil each have their karmic counterparts; how can blame be laid upon the unseen sages?

In the boundless worlds of all heavens, all sentient beings, you Daoist followers, should copy this scripture, distribute it, and recite it in turn. The merit of this scripture is inconceivable. Above, it resolves heavenly calamities; below, it delivers those in eternal night. The blessing of copying it aids life after life; the power of reciting it brings boundless wealth and nobility.

At that time, the celestial assembly—the Three Origins, Nine Bureaus, Five Emperors, Four Offices, and all perfected beings—bowed their heads in praise. From this moment onward, if within the ten directions of the world or the lands of the great chiliocosm there arise floods, droughts, or warfare, causing the people of a nation to suffer or perish, then in the northern gate of that land, or in a pure and secluded place, or within an ancient altar or purified chamber, establish a ritual site. Hang banners and images, perform grand offerings to the Five Stars and the Twenty-Eight Constellations, and invoke the immortals of the Three Origins. I shall ensure that winds and rains come in season, that warfare subsides, that the king governs with the Dao, that the world knows great peace, and that the people enjoy abundance and joy.

If within a household many suffer illness, if the family dwells in misfortune, if curses or oppressions afflict them, if demonic forces bring harm, if pestilence strikes, if madness or wind disorders arise, if qi brings calamity, or if baleful stars descend disaster—then purify the home, set up images, burn incense, and reverently recite this scripture.
